Markdown.name: Markdown
Markdown.comment:
Markdown.

@docs parse, jsonFrontmatter, toHtml, toJson, jsonDecoder

values.name: jsonDecoder
values.comment: Decoder that decodes a JSON encoded `Block`.

values.name: parse
values.comment: Parse an entire markdown document with or without frontmatter.
values.type: { frontmatter : Maybe.Maybe (Markdown.Parser.Frontmatter.Types.Parser metadata) } -> String.String -> { metadata : Maybe.Maybe metadata, blocks : Array.Array Markdown.Block.Block }

values.name: toHtml
values.comment:
Transform a Markdown block into HTML.

This function uses the default options:
- `imageLoadingStrategy`: `eager`, the browser default.

If you want to use custom options, check out the `toHtmlWithOptions`
function in the `Markdown.Transmutationist` module.

values.name: toJson
values.comment: Transform a Markdown block into JSON.

unions.name: Block
cases: { tagName : String.String, attributes : Dict.Dict String.String String.String }

values.name: parseRaw
values.comment: Parse blocks without parsing the inline elements.

aliases.name: Parser
aliases.type: Parser.Parser { metadata : Maybe.Maybe m, markdown : String.String }

Markdown.Transmutationist.name: Markdown.Transmutationist

values.name: inlineToHtml
values.comment:
Transform an inline Markdown element into HTML.

This function uses the default options:
- `imageLoadingStrategy`: `eager`, the browser default.

values.name: inlineToHtmlWithOptions
values.comment: Transform an inline Markdown element into HTML, with options.

values.name: toHtml
values.comment:
Transform a Markdown block into HTML.

This function uses the default options:
- `imageLoadingStrategy`: `eager`, the browser default.

values.name: toHtmlWithOptions
values.comment: Transform a Markdown block into HTML, with options.
